alert.note: Alert for Cheatham (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 1:59PM CST until February 26 at 2:48AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs affecting Cheatham County. For the Harpeth River...including Kingston Springs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, The access road to the Narrows of the Harpeth State Park begins to be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 22.2 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM CST Thursday was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.4 feet on 01/23/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
